info.title: Towards a Canonical Form for British Blazons

sect1.title: Purpose
sect1.para: This document proposes a standard for the textual presentation of British blazons, the language used to describe items of heraldry. This presentation
Three alternative, but wholly equivalent presentation methods are described:
Minimised the shortest possible text description which still allows the entire heraldic device to be re-created.
Plain Text A full, appropriately indented, description of the heraldic device.
Rich Text A full, appropriately indented, description of the heraldic device which uses additional font effects to further identify types of component.

sect1.title: Definitions
sect1.para: Since the presentation recommendations are based on the category of the heraldic term we must define these terms clearly. This section contains the category definitions.
Sometimes these terms are used differently in the heraldic literature, however the definitions shown here are considered definitive for the purpose of this document and the presentation proposals.

sect2.title: Container Elements
sect2.para: Container Elements contain other heraldic terms, they don't have a meaning on their own.

Device we use this term to refer to any complete item of heraldic imagery. So this may be an entire achievement, a single shield image or any combination of other container elements. It is the "thing" that the blazon is intended to describe.
Achievement - encompasses all other components, including the shield, crest, compartment, supporters and motto. This is the highest level of container.
Shield - this the variable shaped region containing the field, ordinaries and charges.
Marshalling - a container for two or more shields or further marshallings combined with the same device.
Sub-shield - (not a strictly heraldic term but useful when discussing marshalled shields).
Crest - placed on top of the shield and consisting of helmets, bourlets and other charges. A shield may have more than one crest
Supporters - charges placed either side of the shield.
Compartment - charge which the shield rests upon.
Mantling - decorative charge around and behind the shield
Motto - ribbon like region containing a text-base charge

sect2.title: Shield Elements
sect2.para: These are elements that primarily appear on the shield, although some may also appear as part of the crest, or as supporters
Field - the entire body of the shield itself
Ordinary - a pre-defined shape in a fixed position on the field
Charge - an abstract or concrete represenatation that can appear multiple times, in multiple locations and is subject to considerable variation
